title: Server Outage 12/1/2016 MEGATHREAD
body:
In an effort to actually be useful and provide info to Rioters as well as clean up the rest of the Help/Support page, I decided to start this.

I'd like to ask people to post:

* General location info. City and State should be enough.

* Name of your Internet Service Provider

* Copypastes of your [Tracerts](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2), if you can.

If anyone else has any more info, that should help, too.
Upvote this to the top if you can, so we can filter out the rabble and actually get relevant info to Rioters.

replies.body:
Hey, I appreciate you being proactive and taking the initiative to consolidate info for us. ^.^

It turns out there was an external network issue that affected a few of our service platforms. Luckily, this issue was fairly quickly resolved and everything is back up now.

Thanks again for reporting the issue and taking action to prevent extra clutter here on H&S, mate. Keep on rockin' on!

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

How do we start the Legacy client if it won't let us?

The "beta" client only tells me I have no internet connection (I obviously do), and my options are Restart or Shutdown. I can't click Launch Legacy Client.

Kentucky here reporting in, Xfinity.

load up beta client, press alt+f4, this will prompt you with a "would you like to exit" screen on the client, press no. This will get rid of the error message and give you the ability to either login to the beta client (it will let you, but the play button is grayed out), or you can click "launch legacy client"

I'm actually able to play now though I'm not sure if that's just the legacy client or flushdns refreshing it.

I'll admit. I was just lucky enough to jump on it before the error poached me.
For the record, if you click the launch legacy client button in the bottom right hand side of the client it lets you play {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

It appears the issue is resolved? All I did was take advantage of using the legacy client before the error poached me.
I also went to cmd.exe and ran "ipconfig /flushdns"

Let me start:

* Location: Columbus, GA

* Internet Provider: WOW! Internet (WideOpenWest / previously Knology before WOW! took over)

* Tracert info below. **Might need someone to confirm if it's the right IP to query.**

* **Some notes:** I was already logged into the new client then it simply kicked me. Strangely enough, I can... actually log in via the legacy client now. Going back to make sure I can do so on the Beta Client now. Will share results when I can.

Same reported issue, game wants to restart trying to connect to the server.

Good luck.
